TITLE: Consumer confidence is near its lowest in a decade, and that could be a problem for Biden
SUMMARY: Anxiety over the cost of living and the direction of the economy could prove costly to President Biden â€” and his fellow Democrats.

TITLE: Fed officials welcome inflation news but still see tighter policy ahead
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve officials welcomed Thursday's inflation news but cautioned against getting too excited by the data.

TITLE: Consumer prices rose 0.4% in October, less than expected, as inflation eases
SUMMARY: The consumer price index was expected to rise 0.6% from September to October and 7.9% from a year ago, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: Even with slower inflation, consumer sentiment weakened sharply in November, survey shows
SUMMARY: The University of Michigan Survey of Consumers posted a 54.7 reading for November, down 8.7% from the previous month's reading.

TITLE: UK on the brink of recession after economy contracts by 0.2% in the third quarter
SUMMARY: The third-quarter contraction was less than the -0.5% expected by analysts.
